availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organized in Spencer County and Shelby County, Kentucky. Mustered in early 1865. Officer: Captain Edwin Terrell. Engaged in guerrilla hunting operations in early 1865 around Shelby County, Kentucky. Mentioned in a petition to Thomas Bramlette on behalf of Edwin Terrell, June 10, 1865. Mentioned in a petition to Thomas Bramlette from Edwin Terrell, June 17, 1865.

ab.bibl:
KYR-0001-004-1941
KYR-0001-004-1942
“Terrell: Death of a Notorious Kentucky Guerilla,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.),December 14, 1868, p. 4.
